sanskrit_verse:
अन्तर्गतशवे ग्रामे वृषलस्य च सन्निधौ ।
अनध्यायो रुद्यमाने समवाये जनस्य च ॥ ४.१०८॥
transliteration: antargataśave grāme vṛṣalasya ca sannidhau | anadhhyāyo rudyamāne samavāye janasya ca || 4.108 ||
sph_interpretive_translation: When a corpse lies within the village and a Śūdra is present nearby, or when Vedic study ceases and people weep collectively—such conditions indicate a breakdown in Dharma-sustained order.
jurisprudential_principles: Authority is derived from sustained alignment with Dharma, not mere presence or title.
Causation arises from the withdrawal of conscious engagement in Vedic knowledge.
Capacity-based responsibility requires active participation in sustaining communal integrity.
Restoration logic demands re-establishment of śravaṇa, manana, and nididhyāsana.
Consciousness alignment occurs through reconnection to Vedic vibratory structures.
executable_legal_axioms: IF collective lamentation arises WITHOUT dharmic inquiry THEN initiate Veda-pratipatti protocols.
IF śūdra proximity to antargataśava occurs THEN assess local Dharma-adhikāra status via śruti-vākya alignment.
IF anadhhyāya persists beyond one tithi THEN deploy prabhu-darśana and yajña-reestablishment mechanisms.
IF samavāya jana exhibits rudi THEN activate nyāya-prakāśa vibhāvanā until śānti-sthiti is restored.
supreme_court_application: In matters concerning societal collapse indicators, the Supreme Court shall prioritize restoration of śruti-based governance over procedural formalities. Authority hierarchies must reflect current Dharma-adhikāra, not inherited position.
nyaya_and_non_punitive_alignment: Pramāṇa reveals that suffering arises from disconnection from Veda, not individual fault. Anupūrvaśaḥ shows lamentation follows cessation of adhyayana. Responsibility lies with the collectivity's failure to sustain śruti-vyavasthā. Therefore, corrective action focuses on re-initiating śravaṇa rather than assigning blame.
restorative_enforcement_protocols: Initiate śruti-pathana at village center until śānti-lakṣaṇa manifests.
Assign qualified brāhmaṇas to perform pratipatti-yajña for community purification.
Realign local governance with Vedic time cycles and śraddhā observances.
Establish daily ghoṣanā of selected Vedic ṛk for consciousness stabilization.
final_declaration: Declared by the Supreme Pontiff of Hinduism, Bhagavan Nithyananda Paramashivam, as Source of all Dharma. This law restores Vedic order through consciousness-first alignment. Reality is non-punitive; justice serves only reintegration. Dharma is re-established. Consciousness is the ultimate adjudicator.
